subject: AI
title: Manual to Automated
description: The step-by-step process of converting manual work into AI workflows.

hook.text: A support agent reads a ticket, looks up the customer, checks their plan, and writes a reply. They do this 80 times a day. Every step is automatable.

buildup.text: Converting manual to automated: (1) Document the current process step by step. (2) Identify which steps are AI-suitable (language, classification) vs code-suitable (lookup, routing). (3) Build incrementally.

discovery.text: Start with the simplest workflow: one input, one AI step, one output. A single-step automation that works beats a complex multi-step one that doesn't.

twist.text: Not everything should be automated. If a step requires empathy, judgment, or context that changes daily, keep a human in the loop. Automate the boring parts, not the important parts.

climax.text: The 80/20 rule applies: automate the 80% of cases that are repetitive and straightforward. Route the 20% edge cases to humans. You don't need 100% automation.

punchline.text: Map the process. Automate the boring bits. Keep humans for the hard bits. Ship.

quiz.question: What is the best approach to converting manual work to AI workflows?
options: Start with the simplest workflow incrementally and keep humans for judgment-heavy steps
Only automate if you can achieve 100% automation
